name: Grilled Chicken Thigh and Cucumber Salad
source_file: Grilled Chicken Thigh and Cucumber Salad Recipes - Michael Symon.txt
author: Michael Symon
description: "I'm a thigh guy," says chef Michael Symon. "It has the deepest flavor of all chicken cuts."
ingredients: 6 skin-on, boneless chicken thighs (2 pounds), pounded 1/2 inch thick
1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil
1 small Fresno or red jalapeno chile, thinly sliced
2 tablespoons chopped mint, plus whole leaves for garnish
instructions: Light a grill. Rub the chicken thighs with 2 tablespoons of the olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Arrange the chicken skin side down on the grill and top with a sheet of foil and a weighted heavy baking sheet. Grill the chicken over moderate heat until the skin is golden brown, about 5 minutes.
Turn the chicken skin side up, top with the foil and weighted baking sheet and grill for 3 minutes longer. Remove the baking sheet.
Turn the chicken skin side down once more and grill until the skin is crispy and the chicken is cooked through, about 2 minutes longer. Transfer the chicken to plates.
Meanwhile, in a large bowl, combine the vinegar with the shallot and garlic and gradually whisk in the remaining 1/4 cup of olive oil until well blended.
Add the cucumber, onion, chile and chopped mint and season with salt and pepper. Toss to coat.
Slice the chicken; toss with the cucumber salad. Garnish with the nuts and mint leaves.
notes: Suggested pairing: a juicy, ripe apple-scented Spanish white wine.
